qas.question: Out of the maximum amount of players allowed, one must be a what?
The maximum amount of players exclude what?
What is the maximum amount of players allowed?
If there's a minimum amount of players it's usually what?
Players are usually strategically placed by who?
What position is not required for either team?
What is not excluded from the maximum amount of players?
What amount of players is not allowed?
Who does not usually place players strategically?
What position is not allowed on either team?

context: Each team consists of a maximum of <a2_0><b7_0>eleven<b7_0/><a2_0/> players (excluding <a1_0><b6_0>substitutes<b6_0/><a1_0/>), one of whom must be the <a0_0><b5_0>goalkeeper<b5_0/><a0_0/>. Competition rules may state a minimum number of players required to constitute a team, which is usually <a3_0>seven<a3_0/>. Goalkeepers are the only players allowed to play the ball with their hands or arms, provided they do so within the penalty area in front of their own goal. Though there are a variety of positions in which the <b9_0>outfield<b9_0/> (non-goalkeeper) players are strategically placed by a <a4_0><b8_0>coach<b8_0/><a4_0/>, these positions are not defined or required by the Laws.
